185976124.review:
Compared to its predecessor, this game feels like a significant downgrade. Don't get me wrong, it’s a delightful game for kids and casual play, but for a seasoned Lego enthusiast like myself, it fell short.

[h2] What Didn't Work:[/h2]
[list]
[*] Main Quests: The main quests were excruciatingly long and monotonous. Add to that the tedious Lamepool side-missions, which only unlock after free-roam missions, and it becomes quite tiresome.

[*] Free-Roam: Although the free-roam area is larger than the first game, it feels like too much of a good thing, making it boring.

[*] Grandmaster Arena: The arena is glitchy and prone to crashes. I, like many others, had to find workarounds to continue playing.

[*] Content Choices: Instead of adding unessential extras like party mode or pink brick features, a gold brick detector would have been a much better inclusion.

[*] Character Selection: The game boasts over 200 characters, yet manages to exclude the X-Men entirely. Including lesser-known and unpopular Marvel characters while ignoring mutants feels like a missed opportunity.
[/list]
[h2]What I Enjoyed:[/h2]
[list]
[*] The DLC missions were the only redeeming factor for me.
[/list]
In conclusion, this installment gets 10/10 boring sheeps. The first game is easily worth twice this one.

185509279.review:
Одним вечером, мне нечего было делать, и я решил поиграть в эту игру, которую запускал всего один раз со своим другом и благополучно забил, подумал, ну, сейчас спать захочу, а то сидел, ничего не хотелось делать! Всё дело в том, что я раньше очень любил Лего игры, но после, меня начало прям тошнить от них, от того и я удивился, что эта игра меня смогла завлечь...

Однозначно это самая большая ЛЕГО игра, которую я проходил! Причём, игра затянула меня на пол сотни часов таким образом, что я прошёл её на 100% всего за 2 недели! Это было на январских праздниках в основном, но и выходные я тоже с удовольствием прожигал!

Самый большой плюс этой игры, очень интересный и разнообразный открытый мир, который было интересно исследовать! На него мы тратим больше всего времени, поэтому это и заставляет задерживаться в игре! Кусочки самых разных локаций, в одном флаконе - это прям реально бомба!
Самый большой минус - очень душные боссы, наверное самые худшие в Лего играх, просто болванчики, которых нужно затыкивать. Так как челленджа в Лего нет, это просто нудно!
В остальном же, всё впринципе базировано, на уровне остальных Лего игр! Квесты от персонажей очень однотипны и раздражают, головоломки и уровни разнообразные а диалоги написаны для тупых детей...

Мне больше понравилось, чем нет, так что, однозначно рекомендую!

Финальная оценка: 8/10

185143306.review:
Fun LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 is a time travel adventure with many Marvel characters, fun gags, and the classic LEGO touch. From Spider-Man to Gwenpool, the huge cast keeps things fresh as you visit fantastic locations, such as Ancient Egypt and a futuristic New York.

The story is led by Kang the Conqueror and it is compelling, amusing puzzles, awesome combat that rocks co-op mode. While it can sometimes be a touch crazy when it comes to controls, the witticism and creative level design definitely make up for it.

184791672.review:
This is a fun game to play with the family. Even as an adult, I have always had a blast with the Lego Games. I also feel as if they put a lot more care and attention into their games than many game companies do. How is it, the heroes abilities are way better than even some of the more recent AAA games?

I mean I can leap and bound far with Hulk and similar characters, even climb up walls and leap far off them. Boost and fly faster, swing around and do some little moves in the air with Spider-Man. Like I'm very surprised with the movement in a Lego Game.

I had a blast playing through this with my family and hope to see what Lego brings for newer super hero titles and how far they can expand with greater technology.

184720621.review:
NOTE: It is heavily recommended to play this game using an Xbox controller. Unlike Lego Marvel 1, it is incredibly hard to 100% this game using a keyboard. You need ALL the DLCs or the season pass to complete all achievements in this game. You can 100% the game without them.

A decent third entry to the Lego Marvel series. Unlike Lego Avengers and Lego Marvel 1, the graphics (non-lego objects and environment) are enhanced. There are considerable flaws such as Fantastic Four and all Mutants not in the game, but it is still a good game overall. The plot is silly at first but is incredibly good for kids and adults alike. Perfect for family bonding. If you are a completionist, PLEASE get an Xbox controller. It is incredibly hard to complete this using only a keyboard, unlike the previous two Lego Marvel games thanks to the addition of wacky characters with incredibly confusing controls. I simply took a save file online to skip half of the overworld quests because it's just impossible to do with a keyboard (Xbox controllers aren't available in my country). Overall good game!

Also the story of this game is just a major spoiler for Avengers: Doomsday and Secret Wars, but replace Kang with Doctor Doom.

184391583.review:
Ich habe nie nicht gedacht, dass ich jemals eine negative Review zu einem LEGO Spiel schreiben muss.

Nachdem ich LEGO Avengers sehr mittelmäßig fand, dachte ich (vor allem aufgrund der vielen positiven Reviews), dass LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 wesentlich besser ist und hab mich dementsprechend auf das Game gefreut.

Aber Holy Moly lag ich falsch...

Dieses Game hat mich wirklich an meine Grenzen gebracht und ich war mehrmals kurz davor es abzubrechen, hab mich final aber doch dazu entschieden es auf 100% zu vervollständigen.

Zuerst das positive:
+ Das HUD ist ganz cool gestaltet. Das Comicbook Design passt wirklich extrem gut und gibt dem Spiel ein wenig Charme

Joa...Das wars leider. Ich wünschte ich könnte mehr positives aufzählen, aber für mich ist der Rest entweder meh oder scheiße

Die negativen Sachen:
- Die Story ist meh. Nicht gut aber auch nicht sonderlich schlecht. Ich war an keiner Stelle richtig gehookt und war mehr gelangweilt als gespannt was als nächstes passiert

- Die Level ziehen sich wie Käse beim Fondue und werden schnell eintönig. Am Ende jedes Levels wartet ein Boss. Diese Bosse sind die nervigsten und langweiligsten, die ich je bekämpft habe. Fast alle bestehen nur aus einen Knopf spammen und zwischendrin warten bis der Boss nicht mehr unverwundbar ist. Andere LEGO Games haben sich hier wenigstens eine spannende Mechanik ausgedacht um die Bosse nicht monoton zu designen, aber hier fühlen sich alle Bosse (abgesehen vom Ersten und Letzten) gleich an und keiner bleibt im Kopf.

- Die AI der Gegner und Verbündeten war noch nie so schlecht wie in diesem Game. Ständig bleibt irgendwo ne Figur hängen oder steigt nicht auf Schalter, sodass man beten muss, dass man im Level weiterkommt

- Das Game ist verbuggt wie sonst was. Verbündete glitchen sich fest oder Events passieren nicht sodass man das Level neu starten muss, das Game stürzt ab und manche Sounds (z.B die bei der Spider-Man Outfit Change Animation) sind 10x lauter als andere

- Das Character Roster ist VIEL zu riesig. Klar das kann seine Vorteile haben, aber ich habe das Spiel ungelogen mit maximal 30 unterschiedlichen Charakteren auf 100% gebracht obwohl das Spiel ca 240 Charaktere hat.

- Der Multiplayer "Battle Mode" funktioniert nicht, außer man stellt seinen PC so ein, dass er auf niedrigerer Leistung hochfährt, weil beim Starten des Modus ansonsten durchgehend das Spiel abstürzt

- Warum auch immer hat man sich dazu entschlossen, dass gewisse Segmente des Spiels nicht übersprungen werden können, wie z.B die 1 Minute lange Intro Sequenz oder die Zusammenfassung der Collectables am Ende eines Levels

- Bei der Steuerung hat man sich gedacht, dass es ja bestimmt mehr Spaß macht, wenn man statt ein kleines Menü zu bekommen, bei der man seine Charaktere im Story Mode einzeln auswählen kann, man stattdessen so oft Y drücken muss, bis man den richtigen Charakter bekommen hat OHNE dabei die fucking "Team-Attack" auszulösen, die spaßigerweise ebenfalls auf Y liegt und eine mal mehr und mal weniger riesige Hitbox hat, wodurch man sich erstmal 4 mal die gleiche Team Attack anschaut, bevor man beim richtigen Charakter gelandet ist.

- Die Open World ist zwar riesig, aber die Missionen waren noch nie so repetitiv und unkreativ wie hier. Seeehr viele Missionen sind nach 5 unterschiedlichen Ideen aufgebaut. 
1. Kleines Rätsel (90% sind zu einfach 10% sind okay )
2. Folge dem Charakter und töte ein paar Gegner
3. Fliege zu ca. 7 Charakteren auf der Map und rede mit ihnen
4. Besiege ganz viele Gegner
5. Zeitrennen, das viel zu einfach ist und kein bisschen Herausforderung mitbringt

Bisschen mehr Variation in dem Missionsdesign wäre spannender gewesen, vorallem wenn es knapp 255 Gold Bricks gibt

- Die ""Minimap"" die man in diesem Spiel hat ist basically useless. Missionsicons sieht man nur auf der großen Map und wird fast nur für Schema 3 der oberen Liste benutzt

Dieses Spiel macht mich traurig. Es ist ein massives Downgrade zum Vorgänger und ist mit fucking 40€ - 45€ meiner Meinung nach VIEL zu teuer. Kauft es euch im Sale oder noch viel besser: Kauft es euch gar nicht. Dieses Game verschwendet eure Zeit. Ich habe 62 Stunden meines Lebens verschwendet, weil LEGO Games meine Kindheit sind und ich permanent die Hoffnung hatte, dass mich doch noch irgendwas anspricht und jetzt... sitz ich hier und schreib ne halbe Bibel darüber warum das Game kacke ist.

Kauft euch stattdessen God of War Ragnarök....oder Lethal Company.....Oder Balatro....oder irgendein anderes LEGO Game.

Cheers

184191514.review:
Nota: ★★★★☆ (4/5)
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
O jogo é bom e segue bem a fórmula clássica dos jogos LEGO. O que realmente se destaca aqui é a forma como tudo isso se encaixa perfeitamente com o vasto elenco de personagens da Marvel. São muitos heróis e vilões, o que torna a experiência ainda mais interessante. A mistura do estilo LEGO com o universo Marvel funciona muito bem, proporcionando uma jogabilidade divertida e cheia de possibilidades.

Porém, é impossível não notar que o jogo pode se tornar massante com o tempo. As missões do mundo aberto, por mais que ofereçam boas surpresas, acabam se tornando um pouco repetitivas. Muitas delas seguem um padrão bem genérico de “vá para o ponto X, derrote Y, colete Z”. Isso, embora ainda divertido nas primeiras horas, pode cansar mais à medida que o jogo avança, tornando a experiência um pouco arrastada.

183700529.review:
Lego Marvel Super Heroes 2 é um jogo que foi desenvolvido e publicado pela TT Games e lançado em Novembro de 2017, sendo uma continuação direta dos eventos dos primeiros jogos, Lego Marvel Super Heroes (2013) e Lego Marvel's Avengers (2016). Trazendo uma nova ideia de narrativa juntando os mais diversos heróis e diferentes versos para derrotar um inimigo em comum.
 O videojogo segue a jogabilidade clássica da franquia LEGO, porém com uma fluidez muito maior. Os gráficos aumentaram significativamente em comparação aos seus antecessores, possui um visual extremamente vivo, colorido e muito grande.
 As principais críticas a esta obra são a falta de heróis muito marcantes no mundo dos quadrinhos e filmes da Marvel, como os X-MEN e o Quarteto Fantástico, missões extremamentes repetitivas e monótonas, o jogo é muito maçante e a história pouco cativante.
 Minha nota final para este jogo é 70/100 ou 7/10. Recomendaria este jogo se fosse o único da franquia LEGO heróis que faltasse jogar e se estivesse em uma ótima promoção. Conselho: não pague mais de R$10,00 neste jogo.

183662829.review: É muito maçante, mas tem algumas fases legais.

183584730.review: its cool, kinda boring tbh, u might need a friend to play with

183559370.review: Nice game for less tan 2$ on sale!!!!

183535629.review:
LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 1 was the first LEGO game i have ever played, it's been over 8 years now but i still remember it being one of my favorite games that year, an easy 8/10, it was a joy to 100% and i simply could not get enough of it, so it pains me to say this sequel is one of the worst games i played in a while now and feels like a downgrade in almost every aspect..

Let's start with [b]the good[/b]:

+ Massive roster full of so many cool lesser known characters, i'm a big Marvel comics fan so i'm kind of biased in this aspect. (but they removed all the X-Men which is a big big shame..)

+ Some really cool cutscenes, it's always fun watching the LEGO mini-figures interact with each other and it helps that they have a timeless look.


I can't for the life of me think of any other major positives to mention so moving on to [b]the bad[/b]:

- They replaced the famous hearts system for enemies with a new health bar system, which only serves to make them much more bullet spongy and turns boss fights especially from short, fun, unique encounters to a mind-numbing slugfest that drags on for way too long, which kills any and all momentum the game might've had up to that point, simply horrendous..

- You can no longer skip post level summery, why?

- Before you start a new level in free-roam you're now forced to either face a very tedious boss fight with a billion minions, many of which have the new annoying bullet-spongy health bars that you can only damage a 3rd of the time OR a very tedious quest consisted of doing some of the most boring shit ever for way too long repeating it up to 5 times in a row, just why?????

- Horrible horrible new flight controls as they're now forcefully bound to the camera stick, so if you want to hover up you're forced to awkwardly look up, want to look down while flying up? taught luck. It's simply unusable, i used to love flying as iron man in the first game, well not anymore now...

- The levels are bland & uninspiring, and feel way too long thanks to the issues i mentioned earlier, and generally speaking they seem of lower quality compared to how i remember the first game.

- Whoever is responsible of designing the side content in this game is an evil man/woman, some of the worst side content i've ever had the displeasure of experiencing in a LEGO game, with a map riddled with a billion icons that would put any Ubisoft map to shame.. i swear if i have to do any more of the "go get me 10 random items scattered throughout the huge map" [strike]bitch[/strike] fetch quests i'll fricking snap.. also why are the endless challenge items required for 100% not marked on the map?

- Pink bricks seem to be locked behind finishing the endless open world slop i just mentioned earlier now, stuff i wanted to get before redoing levels for 100% which should've been available to buy from the get go. (or keep them locked behind Gwenpool missions but make those available from the get go instead, or at least once you finish the main campaign..)

- Bugs, bugs and even more bugs (falling through the map, enemies not spawning, enemies disappearing, quests breaking, doors not opening..etc) with multiple being game-breaking, i literally faced my first game-breaking bug at the very first level of the game with a ship door(?) thingy that was supposed to open for me to progress but never did until i started a new save.
I also saw multiple people claiming they had quests bug on them or gold bricks not spawning when they were at like 95-97% completion rate. (my biggest nightmare)

- The AI for companions is braindead, they can't even do something as simple as follow you around the level, so you're often forced to switch back to your 3rd companion to bring them up to speed. (The AI is pretty much useless here & i don't remember it being this bad in the other LEGO games.)

I'm sick of even thinking about the rest of the negatives so here is a rapid fire list: (there are more, i'm just not gonna bother.)
- A very long unskippable cutscene every time you launch the game.
- Extremely slow & sluggish underwater levels.
- Horrible disjointed map, a massive downgrade compared to the first game.
- Achievements locked behind DLC missions.
- Browsing the roster & looking for someone specific is a massive pain.
- Sluggish controls with multiple actions bound to the same button, the worst being multiple actions bound to the switch characters button.


[b]The meh[/b]:

- The story was pretty meh, a lot of it felt forced just to showcase the new characters, many parts of it felt pretty repetitive, it reeks of low effort and it could've been much much better had they spent more time on it and less time on the open world slop, it's still passable though.

- Voice acting is a mixed bag.


I really regret not stopping playing this after finishing the main campaign, it's simply horrible to 100% & not worth the time investment in the slightest (but alas, i already started working on it & i really hate leaving stuff unfinished so i'll have to slug through the rest and hope i won't hit any more game breaking bugs that will wipe out all my progress).

If you want my advice just skip this one altogether and go play the first one instead, but if you insist on getting it i'd say heavily temper your expectations and only buy it on a deep deep sale (and for the love of god don't subjugate your poor children to the horrible slugfest of the open world). 4/10

183528009.review: The most buggy Lego game I have ever played. So buggy that it becomes a chore to play it, because you constantly ask yourself if the game will even *let* you play it. Sometimes it crashes twice within five minutes of play, or the sound just doesn't work, or the game won't even start etc. etc.
